title: Hundreds of thousands of students to get GCSE results in England, Northern Ireland and Wales
description: Students in England, Wales and Northern Ireland will receive GCSE, BTecs and Cambridge Nationals results from 08:00 BST.
content:

title: US Open 2025: Sara Errani and Andrea Vavussori win mixed doubles title by beating Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud
description: Italian pair Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori complete their "mission" by beating Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud to win the revamped US Open mixed event.
content:
Italian doubles specialists Sara Errani and Andrea Vavassori completed their "mission" by beating singles stars Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud to win the controversially revamped US Open mixed event.

title: How Trump's Republicans are literally redrawing maps to help stay in power
description: Texas is within touching distance of gaining approval to re-draw its congressional maps before next year's midterm elections. The move, spearheaded by Donald Trump, is known as redistricting - here's everything you need to know about it.
content:
Legislators in Texas have approved new congressional maps designed to boost Donald Trump's Republicans at next year's midterm elections.
Known as redistricting, the state's re-drawn map would shift conservative voters into districts currently held by... [5879 chars]

title: Delta and United sued for selling 'window seats' without windows
description: Delta and United are being sued over allegedly charging extra for seats next to a blank walls.
content:
The lawsuits, which are similarly worded, seek refunds of extra fees for passengers who said they had paid for window seats but got windowless ones instead.
Both lawsuits, which have been seen by the BBC, were filed by legal firm Greenbaum Olbrantz.

title: ICC 'deplores' new US sanctions on its judges and prosecutors
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio denounces the court as "an instrument of lawfare" against the US and Israel.
content:
France also joined the ICC in denouncing the US move, expressing "dismay" as one of its judges, Nicolas Guillou, was among those sanctioned.
